alert.note: Alert for Iron (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 16 at 4:47AM EDT until October 18 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 2 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy, wet snow expected across northern portions of the county. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches with locally higher amounts approaching 10 inches. Less than two inches is expected across southern portions of the county from Iron River to Crystal Falls. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Iron County. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 2 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. Gusty winds and wet snow could bring down tree branches, resulting in sporadic power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Since this is the first winter storm of the season, extra caution is urged for those who must travel.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
